title: bump up v2.3.0
body: release v2.3.0

title: handle empty response
body:
When the server sends RST packet without any contents, the incoming
thread will be shutdown with IO error. But outbound thread keeps alive
because it doesn't recognize incoming thread termination.

In this commit, I added channels to notify incoming thread termination
to outbound thread and outbound thread termination to incoming thread.

title: Update CI env
body:
Now [CI is failing](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/Idein/gatekeeper/168/workflows/2787303d-e631-462e-ab0c-d10a290e0cd7/jobs/374) with:
-  `You’re using a deprecated Docker convenience image. Upgrade to a next-gen Docker convenience image.` and
-  `This job was rejected because the image is unavailable`.

Update docker images used for CI jobs.

title: Bump regex from 1.3.6 to 1.5.5

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [regex](https://github.com/rust-lang/regex) from 1.3.6 to 1.5.5.
Changelog

Sourced from regex's changelog.

1.5.5 (2022-03-08)

This releases fixes a security bug in the regex compiler. This bug permits a vector for a denial-of-service attack in cases where the regex being compiled is untrusted. There are no known problems where the regex is itself trusted, including in cases of untrusted haystacks.

  • SECURITY #GHSA-m5pq-gvj9-9vr8: Fixes a bug in the regex compiler where empty sub-expressions subverted the existing mitigations in place to enforce a size limit on compiled regexes. The Rust Security Response WG published an advisory about this: https://groups.google.com/g/rustlang-security-announcements/c/NcNNL1Jq7Yw

1.5.4 (2021-05-06)

This release fixes another compilation failure when building regex. This time, the fix is for when the pattern feature is enabled, which only works on nightly Rust. CI has been updated to test this case.

  • [BUG #772](rust-lang/regex#772): Fix build when pattern feature is enabled.

1.5.3 (2021-05-01)

This releases fixes a bug when building regex with only the unicode-perl feature. It turns out that while CI was building this configuration, it wasn't actually failing the overall build on a failed compilation.

  • [BUG #769](rust-lang/regex#769): Fix build in regex-syntax when only the unicode-perl feature is enabled.

1.5.2 (2021-05-01)

This release fixes a performance bug when Unicode word boundaries are used. Namely, for certain regexes on certain inputs, it's possible for the lazy DFA to stop searching (causing a fallback to a slower engine) when it doesn't actually need to.

[PR #768](rust-lang/regex#768) fixes the bug, which was originally reported in ripgrep#1860.

1.5.1 (2021-04-30)

This is a patch release that fixes a compilation error when the perf-literal feature is not enabled.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • d130381 1.5.5
  • ae70b41 security: fix denial-of-service bug in compiler
  • b92ffd5 cargo: use SPDX license format
  • f6e52da syntax: fix 'unused' warnings
  • 5197f21 fuzz: do not use inherits in Cargo.toml
  • 3662851 doc: fix typo
  • 63ee669 syntax/doc: fix 'their' typo
  • d6bc7a4 readme: remove broken badge
  • bd74660 fuzz: try to fix build issue
  • bd0a142 readme: fix badges
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Bump arc-swap from 0.4.5 to 0.4.8

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [arc-swap](https://github.com/vorner/arc-swap) from 0.4.5 to 0.4.8.
Changelog

Sourced from arc-swap's changelog.

0.4.8

  • Backport of fix to soundness issue in #45 (access::Map from Constant can lead to dangling references).

0.4.7

  • Rename the unstable-weak to weak feature. The support is now available on 1.45 (currently in beta).

0.4.6

  • Adjust to Weak::as_ptr from std (the weak pointer support, relying on unstable features).
  • Support running on miri (without some optimizations), so dependencies may run miri tests.
  • Little optimization when waiting out the contention on write operations.
Commits
  • 34b809f Fix soundness hole around access::Map
  • 77b5be7 Release 0.4.7
  • 1cd19c3 Stabilized weak support
  • ee8b86e Lint management
  • 315f73b Version 0.4.6
  • 005ec45 Merge branch 'miri'
  • 8a93bb5 Update the weak ptr support for newer Rust
  • 88fc681 Some trivial version updates
  • e3f8538 Get rid of the model dependency
  • 09cb648 Don't run pause/yield in the last iteration of wait_for_readers
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Bump nix from 0.17.0 to 0.20.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [nix](https://github.com/nix-rust/nix) from 0.17.0 to 0.20.2.
Changelog

Sourced from nix's changelog.

[0.20.2] - 28 September 2021

Added

Changed

Fixed

  • Fixed buffer overflow in unistd::getgrouplist. (#1545)

[0.20.1] - 13 August 2021

Added

Changed

Fixed

  • Locked bitflags to < 1.3.0 to fix the build with rust < 1.46.0.

Removed

  • Removed a couple of termios constants on redox that were never actually supported. (#1483)

[0.20.0] - 20 February 2021

Added

  • Added a passwd field to Group (#1338)
  • Added mremap (#1306)
  • Added personality (#1331)
  • Added limited Fuchsia support (#1285)
  • Added getpeereid (#1342)
  • Implemented IntoIterator for Dir (#1333).

Changed

  • Minimum supported Rust version is now 1.40.0. (#1356)
  • i686-apple-darwin has been demoted to Tier 2 support, because it's deprecated by Xcode. (#1350)
  • Fixed calling recvfrom on an AddrFamily::Packet socket (#1344)

Fixed

  • TimerFd now closes the underlying fd on drop. (#1381)
  • Define *_MAGIC filesystem constants on Linux s390x (#1372)
  • mqueue, sysinfo, timespec, statfs, test_ptrace_syscall() on x32 (#1366)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 72d805a (cargo-release) version 0.20.2
  • 199acc7 [skip ci] update version in README
  • 94ccf88 Fix memory unsafety in unistd::getgrouplist
  • de534c1 Release 0.20.1
  • b13f73c Fix a non_fmt_panic warning with Rustc 1.52.0
  • c0a9fd7 Use memoffset::offset_of instead of homegrown macro
  • e266b7c Fix test_vsock failure on VMADDR_CID_LOCAL testing
  • feb8fe6 Remove some actually unsupported termios iflags on redox
  • 97f6ec5 Lock bitflags to < 1.3.0 to fix the build with rust < 1.46.0
  • 4c70217 Merge pull request #1389 from asomers/r0.20.0
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Introduce formatter and linter
body: Fixes of code are results of clippy.

title: Rust 1.50.0
body:
- Updated the rust version to 1.50.0.
- Fixed dependencies that don't work with rust 1.50.0.
- Updated CI image

title: Fix/addr swap
body: fixes #43

title: Naming thread
body: Specify the name of the thread in spawn to identify where the error occurred.

title: bump up v2.2.0
body:
`release 2.2.0`

## Enhancement

- Support wildcards that match any alphanumeric character or hyphen (#44)

title: Support wildcard
body: Added a `wildcard` field to the `Domain`  to specify a domain like `*.execute-api.*.amazonaws.com`.

title: bump up v2.1.0
body:
`release 2.1.0`

## Improvements
- Enlarge listen queue size from 0 to 256 (#41)

title: Changed listen(2)'s backlog parameter from 0 to 256 to surely accept connection from clients
Fix Dockerfile.arm32v6
body:
Fix for arm32v{6,7}, which solves a problem where arm32v6 builds don't work.

- The `--target` option is now specified during cargo build.
- Removed the unnecessary `--default-toolchain` and `--target` specification when installing Rust, and `/gatekeeper/rust-toolchain` installs the appropriate toolchain.
- Fixed the problem where `$HOME/.cargo/bin` became `/root//.cargo/bin` because `$HOME` was `/root/`.

Tested on PiZero and Pi3B.

title: bump up 2.0.0
body:
`release 2.0.0`

## Improvements
- Improve: rendering style of docs of model (#33)
- Add: mDNS support is added to docker images arm32v6 and arm32v7 (#36)
- Add: the client address to logs from session and relay (#37)

## Breaking Changes
- Rename `mask` to `prefix` for representing CIDR. (#34)

title: Add/client addr to log
body:
Add the client address to logs from session and relay.

Before:
```
INFO  session         > connected: actcast.io:443
TRACE rw_socks_stream > send_connect_reply: ConnectReply { version: ProtocolVersion(5), connect_result: Ok(()), server_addr: IpAddr(V4(0.0.0.0), 1080) }
INFO  relay           > spawned relay: outbound
INFO  relay           > spawned relay: incoming
TRACE relay           > outbound copy: 777 bytes
INFO  relay           > relay thread has been finished.
TRACE relay           > incoming copy: 7979 bytes
INFO  relay           > relay thread has been finished.
DEBUG session         > DisconnectGuard: SessionId(1189185587)
INFO  server          > cmd: Disconnect(SessionId(1189185587))
DEBUG server          > stopping session: SessionId(1189185587)
INFO  server          > session is stopped: SessionId(1189185587)
INFO  server          > cmd: Terminate
TRACE server          > stopping accept thread...
TRACE server          > stopping session threads...
TRACE server          > session threads are stopped
TRACE server          > accept thread is stopped
INFO  server          > server shutdown
```

After:
```
INFO  session         > connected: actcast.io:443: 13.226.77.63:443
TRACE rw_socks_stream > send_connect_reply: ConnectReply { version: ProtocolVersion(5), connect_result: Ok(()), server_addr: IpAddr(V4(0.0.0.0), 1080) }
INFO  relay           > spawned relay: outbound: 145.179.168.192:42659: 13.226.77.63:443
INFO  relay           > spawned relay: incoming: 145.179.168.192:42659: 13.226.77.63:443
TRACE relay           > outbound: 145.179.168.192:42659 ==> 13.226.77.63:443: 777 bytes
INFO  relay           > relay thread has been finished: outbound: 145.179.168.192:42659: 13.226.77.63:443
TRACE relay           > incoming: 145.179.168.192:42659 ==> 13.226.77.63:443: 7970 bytes
INFO  relay           > relay thread has been finished: incoming: 145.179.168.192:42659: 13.226.77.63:443
DEBUG session         > DisconnectGuard: SessionId(2342457054)
INFO  server          > cmd: Disconnect(SessionId(2342457054))
TRACE session         > stop session: 145.179.168.192:42659
TRACE session         > join session: 145.179.168.192:42659
INFO  server          > session is stopped: 145.179.168.192:42659: SessionId(2342457054)
INFO  server          > cmd: Terminate
DEBUG server          > join accept thread
INFO  server          > server shutdown
```

title: Support mDNS
body:
mDNS support is added in build for arm32v6 and arm32v7.

- The size of the image has been increased from 1MB to 70MB.
- arm32v6 and arm32v7 are excluded because they cannot be built by CI (as far as I know now).

title: Use musle to reduce the size of the image for arm32v7 and fix the image for arm32v6
body:
- Reduced the size of `:{version}-arm32v7` from 72.04MB to 1.88MB using `armv7-unknown-linux-musleabihf`.
- Make the image for `:{version}-arm32v6` work.
    - It wasn't working with pizero before the fix.

title: Rename: ipaddr prefix
body:
Rename `mask` to `prefix`. (`mask` represents 0xFFF...00)
 Also, a bug in the IP address matching algorithm with a prefix length has been fixed.

title: Fix: rendering style of docs of model
body:
Fix doc comment annotation for rendering style.
And add some docs of filtering rule format.

title: bump up 1.0.0
body:
`release 1.0.0`

## Improvements
- Gracefull shutdown
    - Wait for the accept thread shutdown. (#27)
    - Collect finished relay thread. (#30)
- Deploy docker image for any release tags. (#31)

title: Deploy the docker image on master merge and tag push
body: closes #26

title: Fix/gc session
body:
Fixes #29

## Bug fixes
- relay thread(s) send `Disconnect` notification to the main thread
- The main thread waits the completion of all sessions

## Misc
- cleanup relay module

title: Fix/join accept thread
body:
Fixes #27
Join accept thread.

title: Fix/path
body:
Fix path to ...
- Readme.md
- LICENSE

title: Release: v0.1.0
body: Release: v0.1.0

title: Packaging: prepare to release
body:
Prepare to release to crates.io.

- Integrate workspace into one gatekeeper crate.

title: cache build targets and rustup
body: cargoの成果物とrustupの成果物それぞれをキャッシュします。 fix #11

title: Tweak/status badge

  from: ![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache--2.0-informational)
  to: ![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache--2.0-informational?style=flat-square)

title: Feature/wait session shutdown

Fixes #4

- Wait for shutting down session thread
  - Add socket read/write timeout to `ServerConfig`
- Return `ConnectionRefused` error
    trapped from socket error

#15 Readmeを書きます。

- [x] インストールの方法

title: Refactor/ctx
body:
ユニットテストの追加と、そこで必要になったリファクタリングをします。

title: Filter rules
body:
#2, #3 接続先によるフィルタを実装。

## 機能
- フィルタ指定を実装
    - 接続先、ポート、プロトコルでフィルタ可能
- フィルタ規則を指定するCLIオプション(`-r,--rule=<yml>`)を追加
    - 許可されていない要求に対して `ConnectionNotAllowed` が返る

## その他
- 認証方式選択と認証プロトコルの実装を `AuthService` に統一

body: #9 CIの設定

プロキシ全体の動作を確認するテストを追加します。
ついでに #7 。

- [x] 結合テスト
- [x] テスト環境
    - [x] docker(httpd)
    - [x] docker(gatekeeperd)

title: Udp/header
body: #1 `UDP_ASOCIATE` 対応のため、まず `UDP request header` の読み書きだけ実装。
